title: Here is a list of 20 articles on dialogue summarization and its applications, up to 2023
**"Abstractive Dialogue Summarization with Semantic Scaffolds"** - Chen, Yen-Chun, et al
**"A Comprehensive Survey on Dialogue Summarization: Recent Advances and New Frontiers"** - Gao, Yang, et al
**"Towards Abstractive Summarization of Long Documents with Hierarchical Attention Mechanisms"** - Cohan, Arman, et al
**"Dialogue Summarization with Pre-trained Language Models"** - Liu, Yang, et al
**"Unsupervised Abstractive Dialogue Summarization for Tete-a-Tetes"** - Gliwa, Bogdan, et al
**"Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** - Raffel, Colin, et al
**"Dialogue State Tracking: A Neural Reading Comprehension Approach"** - Gao, Jianfeng, et al
**"Multi-Document Summarization via Deep Learning Techniques: A Survey"** - El-Kassas
**"A Survey on Recent Approaches for Natural Language Processing in Low-Resource Scenarios"**
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"**
**"Dialogue Summarization with Content Selection Network and Semantic Embedding"** - Chen, Yen-Chun, et al
**"Towards a Better Understanding of Abstractive Summarization Systems"**
Pre-training with Extracted Gap-sentences for Abstractive Summarization"** - Zhang, Jingqing, et al
**"Hierarchical Transformers for Long Document Classification"** - Beltagy, Iz, et al
**"Summarizing Medical Conversations via Identifying Important Utterances"** - Krishna, Pranav, et al
**"Dialogue Summarization with Sentence-Gated Modeling Mechanism"** - Liu, Yang, et al
**"Automatic Dialogue Summarization for Customer Service"** - Goo, Chulaka, et al
**"Towards Abstractive Summarization Using Semantic Representations"**
**"Improving Abstractive Dialogue Summarization with Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning"** - Chen, Yen-Chun, et al
**"A Survey on Deep Learning for Named Entity Recognition"** - Li, Fei, et al

These articles cover a range of techniques and applications in dialogue summarization, including the use of pre-trained language models, hierarchical attention mechanisms, and reinforcement learning. They also explore specific applications such as customer service and medical conversations
